English:
Aha, cutie alert! She looks quiet, too. Perfect
test run for a beginner.
Chinese:
喔，那女孩很可愛呢。
看來也很乖巧，對你這新手正好啊。
Korean:
오~ 저 애 귀엽다.
어른스러워 보이고, 초보자인 너한테는 딱이겠는데
German:
Aha, Schnittenalarm! Wirkt auch eher
zurückhaltend. Perfekt für einen Probelauf.

English: All right, go forth and conquer! Give her a shout!
Chinese: 好，去吧！　跟她搭話吧！
Korean: 좋아, 출정이다! 말 걸어보고 와!
German: Dann mach dich mal ans Aufreißen! Sprich sie an!

English:
Look, you'll be fine. Just remember this special
move. If you ever get stuck...flash her a smile!
Chinese:
放心吧，我教你必殺技。
不知道該怎麼辦的時候……就笑吧！
Korean:
안심해. 필살기를 가르쳐 줄게.
어떻게 하면 좋을지 모르겠으면 그땐… 웃는 거야!
German:
Komm, das wird schon. Denk immer an diesen
Spezialmove: Wenn du nicht weiterweißt ...
Lächle sie einfach an!

English:
Even if you have no clue what to say, a sexy
little grin can rescue the whole vibe.
Chinese:
就算什麼話也沒說，只要露出性感的笑容，
就能變成「氣氛好像不錯」的情況喔。
Korean:
무슨 얘기를 하면 좋을지 모르겠을 때도 섹시한 웃음을 흘리는 걸로
"왠지 좀 좋은 분위기"로 바꿀 수 있어
German:
Auch, wenn dir absolut gar nichts einfällt, kann
ein attraktives Strahlen das Ganze retten.

English: I mean, if you're a hot enough guy, anyway.
Chinese: 只要長越帥，這招效果就會越好──
Korean: 이건 미남이면 미남일수록 효과가 좋은 거지만
German: Natürlich vorausgesetzt, du siehst gut aus.

English:
Well, it's better than just standing there anyway.
Stick with the smile, and even a cutie like her is
putty in your hands! Now go make me proud!
Chinese:
反正，總比什麼都不做好啦！　總之要記得笑！笑容！！
這樣可愛女孩也能手到擒來！　去吧！
Korean:
뭐, 아무것도 하지 않는 것보다야 낫겠지! 
어쨌든 웃는 얼굴! 웃는 얼굴이 중요해!
그러면 귀여운 저 애도 한 방에 넘어올 거야! 가랏!
German:
Immer noch besser, als nur dumm rumzustehen.
Immer schön lächeln, dann liegt dir die Hübsche zu
Füßen! Und jetzt zeig mal, was du gelernt hast!

English: Um, can I help you?
Chinese: ……？　有事嗎？
Korean: …? 뭐죠?
German: Ähm, kann ich dir irgendwie helfen?

English: ...Excuse me?
Chinese: ………怎麼了？
Korean: ……저기요?
German: ... Bitte was?

English:
(Argh, I can't think of anything to say! Okay, time
to pull out Chitose's special move...)
Chinese:
（不行啦，果然找不到話題……！
　千歲教的必殺技，我記得是──）
Korean:
(안되겠어. 역시 무슨 말을 해야 할지 모르겠어…!
 치토세에게 배운 필살기가…)
German:
(Argh, mir fällt nichts ein!
Okay, Zeit für Chitoses Spezialmove ...)

English:
Dead silence.
Smile.
Silly face: (°3°)
Chinese:
保持沉默
露出笑容
做出裝傻的表情（゜３゜）
Korean:
침묵을 지킨다
웃는 얼굴을 한다
딴청을 부린다 (°3°)
German:
Schweigen wie ein Grab.
Lächeln.
Gesicht ziehen: (°3°)

English: Yeah, that was it... Strong and silent.
Chinese: 記得必殺技是──沉默。
Korean: 필살기는 분명히――침묵이야
German: Ja, so läuft’s. Stark und still.

English: Uhh...
German: Ähm ...

English: ...I'm gonna go.
Chinese: 我、我……我要回去了！
Korean: 저, 저는 가야해요!
German: ... Ich gehe dann mal.

English: Yikes. Well, you did all right for a newbie!
Chinese:
……失敗了啊。
嗯，以新手來說，做得不錯喔。
Korean:
……실패인가.
뭐, 초보자치고는 잘했어
German: Autsch. Na, für einen Neuling nicht schlecht!

English: Yeah, that was it... Give her a smile.
Chinese: 記得必殺技是──笑容。
Korean: 필살기는 분명히――웃는 얼굴이야
German: Ja, so läuft’s. Lächle sie an.

English: ...*grin*
German: ... *Grins*

English: Erk!
German: Huch!

English:
What happened to that boy's face? Is he... Is that
supposed to be a smile?!
Chinese:
那、那傢伙的臉是怎麼回事啊……！
那是在笑嗎……！？
Korean:
뭐, 뭐야 저 자식 얼굴은……!
저거, 혹시 웃고있는 건가…?
German:
Was ist denn mit seinem Gesicht passiert?
Soll das ein Lächeln sein?

English:
Oh my god! I didn't know faces could even make
that shape!
Chinese:
騙人的吧……！
有人會有那種表情喔……！？
Korean:
말도 안 돼……!
저딴 얼굴이 있다니……!?
German:
Grundgütiger! Ich wusste gar nicht, dass man
Gesichter so verziehen kann!

English: I... Uh, I, I'm...gaaah!
Chinese:
我、我……啊啊啊、那、那個……
真、真、真是非常抱歉！
Korean: 저, 저……아아아악, 저기, 그……죄,죄, 죄송합니다아아!
German: Ich ... äh ... muss ... aaaah!

English: You got a lot to learn, huh.
Chinese: ……看來你還有得學呢。
Korean: ……너한테는 가르쳐야 할 것들이 엄청 많아 보인다
German: Du musst noch viel lernen, was.

English: Yeah, that was it... Dumbest face you can make.
Chinese: 記得必殺技是──裝傻的表情。
Korean: 필살기는 분명히――딴청피우는 표정이야
German: Ja, so läuft’s. Zeig deine albernste Grimasse.

English: Pfff! HAH! Oh man, your face! Bahahahaha!
Chinese:
…………噗、啊哈哈哈！
那什麼臉啊？　好好笑喔！　啊哈哈哈哈！
Korean:
……풋, 아하하!
뭐야, 그 얼굴? 뭔가 엄청 웃겨! 아하하하하!
German:
Pfff! HAHA! Oh Mann, was für ein Gesicht!
Hahahaha!

English:
Haaaah... Hoo, I haven't laughed that hard in
forever.
Chinese: 啊哈哈……呼，好久沒這樣笑了。
Korean: 아하하……하아, 이렇게 웃어본 거 오랜만이야
German: Haha ... Himmel, lange nicht mehr so gelacht.

English:
Coffee? Well, I'd like to, but I have to meet a
friend...
Chinese:
問我要不要去喝杯茶？
嗯，我是很有興致，但我跟朋友有約了……
Korean:
지금부터 차 마시러?
으음, 재미있을 것 같지만, 친구랑 약속이 있어서…
German:
Einen Kaffee? Gerne, aber ich bin jetzt
verabredet ...

English:
Why don't we trade contact info? We can grab
coffee sometime!
Chinese:
對了，要不要交換聯絡方式啊？
下次再去喝茶吧。
Korean:
맞다, 연락처 교환하실래요?
차는 다음에 마시는 걸로
German:
Lass uns doch Nummern austauschen?
Dann können wir mal Kaffee trinken gehen!

English: Great! All right, see you sometime!
Chinese: 這樣就好了，那麼再見囉！
Korean: 아 됐다. 그럼 또 봐요!
German: Prima! Also, bis dann!

English:
So close! That was really something, especially
for a first-timer.
Chinese:
剛才的真可惜啊！
以第一次來說，做得太漂亮啦！
Korean:
지금 건 좀 아쉬웠다!
그래도 처음치고는 완전 잘했어!
German:
So knapp! Das war schon beachtlich, vor allem
für einen ersten Versuch.

English:
Kind of threw the whole "smile" thing out the
window, but hey, your way is...your way!
Chinese: 雖然不是笑容……不過，那樣也行啦！
Korean: 웃는 얼굴은 아니었지만……뭐, 그런 법도 있는 거니까!
German:
Gelächelt hast du nicht wirklich, aber hey, du
machst es eben auf deine Art!
